svg.style: font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: white; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;

text.tspan: Women participating in decisionmaking vs fertility, 2015
Women participating in three decisions (own healthcare, major household purchases, and visiting family) - % of
women age 15-49; Total Fertility Rate is defined as the average number of children that would be born to a woman
over her lifetime if the woman were to experience the exact curent age-specific fertility rates, and the woman were to
survive from birth to the end of her reproductive career.
Source: World Bank – WDI, UN Population Division (2017 Revision)
